item.description:
The New England Browncoats' annual charity fundraiser returns for its seventh year! Join us at the Coolidge Corner Theatre in Brookline, MA on June 23rd for a midnight showing of "Serenity," the big-screen follow up to Joss Whedon's "Firefly." Ticket sales go to support the charity Equality Now, which advocates for womens' rights around the world; Joss Whedon's mother was involved with the charity. Additionally, we will be having a canned food drive for Rosie's Place; bring a canned good and you will receive a ticket for our prize raffle!

http://cstsboston.blogspot.com/ - visit here for information on the local screening and to pre-order t-shirts and other swag.

http://www.cantstoptheserenity.com/ - visit the national "Can't Stop the Serenity" website to learn more and find other screenings.

http://www.coolidge.org/content/serenity - get tickets here.

Why is Equality Now so important? See Joss Whedon's speech: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cYaczoJMRhs
item.name: Can't Stop the Serenity 2012
